intro: Claytonia ferruginea, commonly known as the rustyleaf springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant features small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive rust-colored tinge on the petals. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine, rusty-colored pubescence, giving it its common name. Claytonia ferruginea is part of the Portulacaceae family and is known for its early spring blooming habit.
